### What operating system and CPU are you using?
<!-- If you're using Linux, you can run `cat /proc/cpuinfo` -->

### Steps to reproduce
<!-- If possible, provide a recipe for reproducing the error. A complete runnable program is good. -->

- deploy a cluster in gcp

- restore data from `dbaas-hibernate`  and prefix `test180`  parameter as below
```
restore full --send-credentials-to-tikv=true --storage=gcs://dbaas-hibernate/test180/ --pd=db-pd.tidb1261141553175334912:2379 --ca=/var/lib/cluster-client-tls/ca.crt --cert=/var/lib/cluster-client-tls/tls.crt --key=/var/lib/cluster-client-tls/tls.key
```

- the restore process will report error

### What did you expect?
restore normally

comments_data.body:
We have reproduced once today, but with a different error message:

```
[2020/05/18 09:14:47.561 +00:00] [ERROR] [sst_importer.rs:129] ["download failed"] [err="Cannot read gcs://dbaas-hibernatetest180//1_16848_1064_2a108431266f8717f750a23dddce0ed9efe0bc29aa32e11951c721c34d12bb81_write.sst: request failed. status: 503 Service Unavailable, text: Backend Error"] [name=1_16848_1064_2a108431266f8717f750a23dddce0ed9efe0bc29aa32e11951c721c34d12bb81_write.sst] [meta="uuid: 36530FEF13A34F22BBE27B7E77198154 range { start: 7480000000000000FF4D5F7280000000E8FF1204D60000000000FA end: 7480000000000000FF4D5F7280000000E8FF1B970E0000000000FA } cf_name: \"write\" region_id: 26500 region_epoch { conf_ver: 5 version: 1082 }"]
```

GCS is replying `503 Service Unavailable` with text `Backend Error`. This happens only on one TiKV node out of three, and should be considered a transient error.

Currently BR will retry on transient errors, but this doesn't seem to be considered such, and thus caused the entire process to be interrupted.

This is probably the same as tidb-challenge-program/bug-hunting-issue#72.

It seems these two errors are showed in the backup / restore process too. 
```
Connection timed out (os error 110)
```
```
Connection disconnect by peer (os error 104)
```
We are also seeing this issue. If you're using the AWS SDK there's a way to configure it so that it automatically does retries with backoff on transient errors.

> We are also seeing this issue. If you're using the AWS SDK there's a way to configure it so that it automatically does retries with backoff on transient errors.

we are working in add retry now.
It would be good to backport this to 3.1 if possible. We are aiming for 4.0 but our largest cluster is currently running on 3.1.
Yes, after this fixed, it will backport to 3.1 and 4.0
PR https://github.com/pingcap/br/pull/298 fix this issue, This pr will be retried when restore encounters any unexpected errorã€‚
What's the progress of this issue?

> What's the progress of this issue?

https://github.com/pingcap/br/pull/298 this PR will retryed when encounter restore failed, and solved this issue. I think this issue could be closed.
